stories.text:
Our team at Segmed.ai (YC W20) wants to prevent malicious users from registering for our application - but not introduce too much friction, leading to churn. We've narrowed down two options: 1. Require a potential user to sit through a demo 2. Require a phone number, text a code, and require the potential user to enter the code

We'd love to hear advice on verifying users and / or the % of drop-off you've seen when requiring a user to sit through a demo.

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Is requiring a demo the best tactic to prevent hackers from registering?

We measured the percentage of Spammy Twitter users

stories.text:
..in terms of startup time.

I am not saying open a terminal than open a text editor. Because in a Windows machine the terminal needs some to initialize.

Except for startup time the features that make Notepad the best text editor in the world. -

- Ability to quickly copy and paste from the global clipboard

- Quickly change zoom with mouse scroll and essentially mouse support

- Word warp

I have tried gvim, sublime text, notepads, notepad++ but nothing beats Notepad's startup time.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there any text editor faster than Notepad on Windows?
